meanings.definition: A member of a cavalry unit in India.
meanings.sent1: The brave sowars rode their horses into battle.
meanings.sent2: The sowars trained diligently to become skilled cavalry members.
meanings.sent3: The sowars joked about having horse races during their breaks.
meanings.sent4: The sowars were like knights of old, charging fearlessly into the fray.
meanings.sent5: The colorful uniforms of the sowars made them stand out on the battlefield.

meanings.definition: A soldier in a cavalry unit.
meanings.sent1: The sowars were respected for their horsemanship skills.
meanings.sent2: Many sowars came from rural areas where they learned to ride early.
meanings.sent3: The sowars playfully argued about who had the fastest horse.
meanings.sent4: The sowars were the swift guardians of the army's flanks.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the sowars' horses thundered across the plains.

meanings.definition: The act of serving as a cavalry soldier.
meanings.sent1: The sowars' duty was to protect the infantry during battles.
meanings.sent2: Serving as sowars required courage and skill on horseback.
meanings.sent3: The sowars shared stories of their adventures around the campfire.
meanings.sent4: The sowars' swift movements on horseback were like poetry in motion.
meanings.sent5: The loyalty of the sowars to their unit was unwavering.
